titleStmt.title: Chicano Time Trip on EastWest Bank
titleStmt.author: Michelle Rolon

div.p: The remarkable murals known as Chicano Time Trip by muralists Wayne Healy and David Botello are painted on the walls of the EastWest Bank on 2601 North Broadway. In the height of the 1970’s Chicano Movement, Healy and Botello collaborated to bring forth the ignored Chican@ presence as a response to the 1976 U.S. Bicentennial that failed to recognize the historic presence of Chican@s in the United States (USC). The five panel mural shows relevant icons of Chican@ identity that are organized historically from right to left beginning with the Mesoamerican period and ending with the contemporary U.S.A.Chican@ family. La Familia, La Soldadera, El Hacendado, La Española, and El Indigeno each carry characteristics of strength, revolution, family, culture, and other important qualities that have transcended through out the years to form Mexican identity (Latorre).

note.placeName: Chicano Time Trip on EastWest Bank
note.p: The remarkable murals known as Chicano Time Trip carry characteristics that have transcended through the years to form Mexican identity.
